business.headline: India's Q2 GDP slows to 5.4%, hits 18-month low on weak consumptionThe weaker-than-expected GDP growth raises concerns about the sustainability of economic recovery, particularly as key sectors like manufacturing and mining face challenges.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as heavyweight stocks gain; Q2 GDP data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 759.05 points to 79,802.79 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 216.95 points to 24,131.10. Both the indices had declined roughly 1.5% yesterday.

PAN 2.0 FAQs: Who can apply, QR code feature, and other key detailsPAN 2.0 is a government initiative combining PAN and TAN systems with a QR code for secure and quick identity verification, simplifying taxpayer registration and promoting a tech-driven tax ecosystem.

Sensex surges 800 points: Key factors behind bull run on Dalal StreetStock market today: Sensex and Nifty regained their footing, driven by improved investor sentiment and stock-specific action. Read on to find out the key reasons behind today's rebound on Dalal Street.

Enviro Infra makes solid market debut: Should you hold or book profit?Enviro Infra IPO listing: Shares of Enviro Infra Engineers have dipped slightly following their strong listing, prompting investors to weigh whether to hold onto their shares or book profits.

Adani Green, Adani Energy Solutions: Why these Adani Group stocks are gainingAdani Green Energy led the surge, rising 14.64% to hit Rs 1,247.55. Adani Energy Solutions followed, reaching a day's high of Rs 825.85. Most other Adani Group stocks also registered gains in early trade.

Enviro Infra shares make strong debut, list at 49% premium over IPO priceEnviro Infra Engineers listing: The shares opened at Rs 220 on the NSE, marking a 48.64% jump from the IPO price of Rs 148. On the BSE, the stock listed at Rs 218, reflecting a 47.29% premium.

Sensex rallies 700 points, Nifty above 24,000; Adani stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 663 points to reach 79,702.09 by 10:33 am, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 154.60 points to trade at 24,084.95.

Sensex crashes 1,200 points, Nifty falls below 24,000; IT stocks tumbleAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex ended 1190.34 points lower at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 to settle below 24,000.

Renewable energy stocks could make your portfolio green. 5 reasons whyWith the global shift towards clean energy, renewable energy stocks have proven to be rewarding for many, delivering strong returns.

Infosys, LTIM, HCLTech, TCS: Why IT stocks are tumbling todayInfosys led the decline with a 3% drop, while Tech Mahindra and LTIMindtree were down by 2.5%. HCLTech, MPhasis, and TCS also recorded losses exceeding 2%.

How this firm is blending sustainability in India's alcohol industryThe company's innovative approach, dubbed 'Grain to Glass', is transforming how businesses can contribute to environmental and social development.

Explained: Why newly-listed NTPC Green Energy shares gained 5% todayNTPC Green Energy share price: The latest surge follows NTPC Green Energy's announcement regarding the commercial operation of the first phase of its Shajapur Solar Project in Madhya Pradesh.

Suraksha Diagnostic IPO opens tomorrow: Check price band, issue size, GMPSuraksha Diagnostic IPO: The IPO will open for bidding on Friday and is expected to list on the stock exchanges on December 6, 2024.

Ola Electric shares continue positive rally, rise above Rs 90. Time to buy?Ola Electric share price: With this, the stock has gained over 35% in the last five sessions and has surpassed the Rs 90 target set by Citi on November 26.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: 4 reasons why Sensex plunged 1,200 points todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1190.34 points at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 points to 23,914.15.
Explained: Why LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade  LIC Stock Price: LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade despite a sharp drop in the benchmark stock market indices.

SpiceJet share price rises after Aircastle drops insolvency caseIn September, SpiceJet announced the resolution of a $23.39 million dispute with Aircastle (Ireland) Designated Activity Company and Wilmington Trust SP Services (Dublin) Limited.

Adani Total Gas share price jumps 16% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Total Gas share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 823.30 before settling at Rs 787, up 13.36% at 10:51 am.

Adani group stocks extend winning streak, rally up to 12% todayAdani Group stocks such as Adani Green Energy Ltd, Adani Power Ltd, Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, and Adani Enterprises Ltd gained as much as 12% after the recent clarification on the US bribery charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Operation Cyber Slaves: Stories of 'Golden Triangle', network of fake job offers India Today's special Investigation Team managed to track down some of the survivors of the cyber slave camps in Southeast Asia, and recorded their stories. These are cautionary tales for all those tempted by dubious job offers from the 'Golden Triangle'.

Cyclone Fengal intensifies, red alert issued for coastal Tamil Nadu, Puducherry Cyclone Fengal has intensified into a storm, bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds. Red alert issued for few Tamil Nadu districts and Puducherry, as authorities mobilise relief efforts and warn fishermen.

Hybrid model only option, ICC tells PCB in Champions Trophy meeting: SourcesThe International Cricket Council informed the Pakistan Cricket Board that a hybrid model is the only feasible option for the Champions Trophy. In the ICC's Board meeting on Friday, November 29, Pakistan remained firm on its stance against hosting a few of the matches at a neutral venue.

Gujarat man arrested for sharing Coast Guard intel with Pak spy for Rs 200 per dayThe ATS probe revealed that Dipesh, a contractual worker at the Okha port, initially came into contact with the agent — who used the alias "Sahima" — through Facebook.

As Hindus see fresh attack, Bangladesh media tom-toms tone-deaf surveyBangladeshi media outlets are highlighting a Voice of America survey claiming minorities feel safer under the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government. What they fail to highlight is the survey's small sample size of 1,000, and the differing perceptions of safety between Muslim and non-Muslim respondents. There's more that the survey reveals.

Hezbollah chief declares 'divine victory' against Israel amid ceasefire dealThe ceasefire stipulates that Hezbollah will withdraw from areas south of the Litani river, which runs some 30 km (20 miles) north of the border with Israel.

Chandrabu Naidu calls for cleansing of revenue department, easy use of services Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu said that documents like birth, death, caste, and income certificates should be easily accessible online, eliminating the need for people to visit government offices.

India's Q2 GDP slows to 5.4%, hits 18-month low on weak consumptionThe weaker-than-expected GDP growth raises concerns about the sustainability of economic recovery, particularly as key sectors like manufacturing and mining face challenges.

Waqf land in India grew from 2 villages gifted by invader Ghori to 9.4 lakh acreWaqf Boards, collectively, are among the top land-owners in India. The first recorded instance of Waqf in India was the gift of two villages in Multan by invader Muhammad Ghori. It was, in fact, Ghori's victory in the Battle of Tarain that established sultans on the throne of Delhi, who institutionalised and oversaw the growth of Waqf.

Why Donald Trump loves YMCA: The 1970s hit is topping charts againDonald Trump's use of the iconic 1978 anthem YMCA has propelled the disco classic back to the top of the charts, sparking controversy and nostalgia — thanks to a surprising 'Trump effect.'

Twist in Maharashtra story as Eknath Shinde decamps, Mahayuti meet called offA meeting of Mahayuti leaders to finalise Maharashtra's government formation was called off on Friday after caretaker Chief Minister Eknath Shinde arrived at his village in Satara district.

Manipur government's 'anti-national' jab at NDA ally over criticism of Biren SinghNDA ally Mizo National Front had sought N Biren Singh's removal, citing his alleged failure to address the ethnic conflict in Manipur.

Watch: Scooter rider in air after hitting divider, miraculously lands on truck bonnetA 10-second video of the incident, shared by an X user, shows the rider losing control of his scooter after hitting a ramp built in front of a divider.

Apple's AirPods Pro 2 ad goes viral, X users say 'no more woke, family is back'Titled 'Heartstrings', the ad depicts a man who struggles with hearing loss and the impact it has on his family life. The campaign has garnered positive reactions on social media, with some interpreting it as a response to broader cultural and political shifts.

Opposition crushing spirit of Constitution, spreading propaganda against NDA: PMThe Prime Minister accused the opposition of spreading lies and rumours to mislead the public, describing such efforts as a major challenge for the country.

Atishi's 'offer' to BJP's Vijender Gupta: Will not field anyone against you if..The Delhi Chief Minister said that if Vijender Gupta convinces Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena to sign the proposal for the reinstatement of bus marshals, she would urge her party not to field any candidate against him in the Rohini Assembly seat.

Diljit Dosanjh visits Dakshineshwar Temple ahead of Kolkata concert. WatchPunjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh made a spiritual stop at Kolkata's Dakshineshwar Temple before his concert. The artist's team shared his experience online via a video.

Allu Arjun thanks fans for making Pushpa a phenomenonPushpa 2 Mumbai event highlights: The makers of Allu Arjun-led film are gearing up for release with a nationwide promotional tour. The film, also starring Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil, releases on December 5.

Hair entangled, legs dangling: Woman's body stuck to front of train in Tamil NaduA woman's body was found stuck on the front end of a Thiruvananthapuram Express train at Tamil Nadu's Perambur railway station, causing shock and distress among passengers.

Messi gets nominated for FIFA Best Award: Fair decision or bias?Lionel Messi's FIFA Best nomination has divided fans and pundits, with questions surrounding his performances in MLS compared to players excelling in Europe's top leagues. The debate intensified as Cristiano Ronaldo's exclusion added another layer of controversy to the discussion.

Delay in OTPs after December 1 due to new traceability rules? TRAI respondsStarting December 1, 2024, the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) will implement its new traceability guidelines to strengthen consumer protection against spam and fraudulent messages.

India following 'double standards' on protection of minorities: BangladeshBangladesh accused India of 'double standards' in protecting minority communities, citing media misinformation. Bangladesh urged its journalists to counter Indian narratives.

Navjot Kaur gets Rs 850 crore notice over cancer recovery claim made by SidhuNavjot Kaur has been asked to produce evidence to support Sidhu's arguments in seven days or else pay Rs 850 crore as compensation for the "misleading" claims.

Exclusive: Deep dive into southeast Asia's ruthless digital scam syndicatesFor over a month, India Today's special investigation team tracked the network of human traffickers and cyber slavery hot spots in Southeast Asia to unravel the people behind online frauds like 'Digital Arrest'.

Watch: SRK as Dr Jehangir turns therapist for Ranbir-Alia in new adA humorous advertisement has taken the internet by storm, featuring Alia Bhatt's character Safeena discussing her relationship woes with Ranbir Kapoor (Bunny) to Shah Rukh Khan (Dr Jehangir).

Nick Jonas kisses daughter Malti in Thanksgiving pics shared by Priyanka ChopraPriyanka Chopra shared heartwarming Thanksgiving photos with Nick Jonas and their daughter, Malti Marie. The family celebrated the holiday with love and joy, capturing the hearts of fans worldwide.

Allu Arjun: Pushpa was made to bring National Award to Telugu film industryAt the Pushpa 2: The Rule Mumbai event, Allu Arjun explained the significance of winning the National Award for his role in Pushpa. He emphasised that it was not merely a personal triumph but a victory for the entire Telugu film industry.

Suriya 44: Shriya Saran confirms special song in Karthik Subbaraj's filmActor Shriya Saran shared her excitement about her special dance number in the upcoming film, Suriya 44. She spoke about it during her appearance at the 55th International Film Festival of India (IFFI).

sports.headline: Mohammed Shami overcomes injury scare in SMAT to bowl full spell: ReportsMohammed Shami overcame an injury scare during Bengal's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match, reassuring fans with his resilience as he completed his spell, underscoring his readiness for a potential return to international cricket.

WWE Survivor Series 2024 Livestreaming in India: All you need to know WWE Survivor Series 2024 brings chaos and drama as top superstars collided in WarGames matches, championship showdowns, and faction rivalries, leaving fans electrified by surprises and unforgettable moments.

Rodrygo returns to Real Madrid training from injury amidst club's strugglesRodrygo's early return to training has lifted Real Madrid's spirits as they navigate injury setbacks and recent struggles, including a Champions League loss to Liverpool. The Brazilian forward could play a key role in revitalising their attacking lineup.

Harsh reality of life: Pankaj Advani on not enough recognition despite 28 world titlesIndia's Pankaj Advani has had a dream run after the cueist won his 28th world title. He defeated Robert Hall of England 4-2 at the IBSF World Billiards Championship that took place in Doha

Novak Djokovic reveals Andy Murray's first reaction to coach proposalNovak Djokovic revealed that Andy Murray was caught off guard when offered the coaching role, turning their storied rivalry into a surprising new partnership ahead of the 2025 Australian Open.

RCB celebrates Kannada heritage, to dub content videos in multiple languagesRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) has established itself as a trailblazer in the realms of sports and digital content, boasting a passionate fanbase that extends across the globe.

Pakistan wasn't an easy tour: Pope finds 'right headspace' vs New ZealandNZ vs ENG: Ollie Pope said that he was happy to score a half-century in the Christchurch Test after having a disappointing tour of Pakistan where he made only 55 runs.

Stubbs, Bavuma break Kallis, de Villiers' record with twin centuriesSA vs SL: Tristan Stubbs and Temba Bavuma scored hundreds to break Jacques Kallis and AB de Villiers' 12-year-old record. The duo also helped the Proteas set Sri Lanka a target of 516 to win.

Watch: Jay Shah, Harmanpreet unveil new ODI jersey with tri-colour gradientThe BCCI unveiled India's new ODI jersey, which features a tri-colour gradient on the shoulders. BCCI secretary Jay Shah and Harmanpreet Kaur attended the ceremony at the board headquarters in Mumbai on Friday, November 29.

World Chess Championship: D Gukesh and Ding Liren play out draw in Game 4World Chess Championships: G Dukesh and Ding Liren played out a draw after 42 moves in Game 4. Resuming after the rest day, the two players played a tense match which fizzled out to a draw.

Fighter Jemimah battles injury to power Brisbane Heat into WBBL final WBBL 2024: Jemimah Rodrigues injured her wrist but made sure that Brisbane Heat beat Sydney Thunder to set up a final with Melbourne Renegades on December 1 at the iconic MCG.

Watch: Du Plessis takes big fall in Abu Dhabi T10 league, saves ball boyFaf du Plessis narrowly avoided injury in the Abu Dhabi T10 League after vaulting over boundary boards to dodge a ball boy during a tense moment in Morrisville Samp Army's clash against Delhi Bulls, showcasing his quick thinking and professionalism.

Delhi become first team in T20 history to use 11 bowlers Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy: Delhi made T20 history on Friday after using all their 11 bowling options in their clash against Manipur at the iconic Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

Prithvi Shaw could not handle money, his example should be studied: AmrePrithvi Shaw was not able to handle the fame and money that comes with the Indian Premier League, said former Delhi Capitals assistant coach Praveen Amre. Shaw was unsold in the 2025 edition of the IPL auction.

After IPL snub, Shardul registers most expensive over in SMAT historyShardul Thakur endured a torrid time against Kerala in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, conceding 69 runs in four overs, just days after going unsold in the IPL mega auction, raising concerns about his form and future prospects.

No consensus at ICC meeting, Pakistan firm on Champions Trophy stance: SourcesChampions Trophy: No consensus was reached between the parties in a brief meeting of the ICC Board on Friday. Pakistan remained firm on its stance to not host the tournament in a hybrid model.

Sindhu, Lakshya storm into Syed Modi International semi-finals Syed Modi International: PV Sindhu and Lakshya Sen stormed into the semi-finals of the Super 300 badminton tournament after beating Dai Wang and Meiraba Luwang Maisnam in the quarters.

Shubman Gill 'happy' with injury recovery, geared for Adelaide TestAUS vs IND: After missing the series opener at the Perth Stadium, Shubman Gill returned to the nets on Friday and sounded positive about his injury recovery from the Adelaide Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
